message.content:
cs.IT, cs.ITP, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with information theory and communication, specifically the two-receiver general broadcast channel. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also introduces a new tool based on an identity that relates the second derivative of the Shannon entropy of a discrete random variable to the corresponding Fisher information, which suggests a connection to cs.ITP (Information Theory and Probability). The paper also involves mathematical analysis and optimization, which could fall under cs.MM (Mathematical Methods) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Lastly, the paper discusses the inner and outer bounds of the broadcast channel, which could relate to cs.SI (Systems and Control).
